profiles.name: Fall of the Roman Empire
clues: Culminated in 476 AD when the last Western Emperor was deposed
Economic collapse was triggered by debasement of currency and inflation
Military stretched thin defending thousands of miles of borders
Division into Eastern and Western halves accelerated the process
Barbarian invasions were a symptom, not the primary cause
The Eastern portion survived for another thousand years
Augustine wrote 'City of God' partly in response to this event
Trade networks that sustained the economy had already fragmented
The Visigoths, Ostrogoths, and Vandals filled the power vacuum
Constantinople remained a prosperous capital during Western decline
Latin evolved into Romance languages during this transition period
The Catholic Church filled administrative gaps left behind
Rome's slave-based economy became unsustainable over time
Germanic tribes gradually migrated into Roman territories
Taxation became impossible to collect across vast regions
Urban centers depopulated as trade networks collapsed
The Silk Road disruptions reduced Eastern wealth flowing West
Military reform attempts under Diocletian temporarily stabilized it
Lead poisoning from water pipes may have affected decision-making
This period marks the transition to the Medieval Age

profiles.name: The Black Death
clues: Killed an estimated 75-200 million people globally in the 14th century
Originated in Central Asia and spread via trade routes
Fleas on black rats were the primary vector of transmission
Wiped out 30-60% of Europe's population between 1347-1353
Caused massive labor shortages that increased workers' bargaining power
Flagellant movements emerged as people sought spiritual explanations
Jewish communities were scapegoated and massacred across Europe
Medical understanding was so poor that bloodletting was prescribed
Cities were hit harder than rural areas due to population density
Trade collapsed, reducing European prosperity for decades
The Great Mortality triggered the Peasants' Revolt in England
Artistic depictions became obsessed with 'danse macabre' themes
Recovery took over a century in many regions
Survived in animal reservoirs in Central Asian steppes
Mortality rates varied wildly by location and season
Created severe social upheaval and challenged feudal structures
Some historians argue it helped end the Medieval period
Spread faster along maritime trade routes than overland
Hygiene understanding didn't improve until centuries later
It caused the period to be called the 'Late Medieval Crisis'

profiles.name: The French Revolution
clues: Began in 1789 with the storming of the Bastille
Financial crisis and famine were major underlying causes
The Third Estate represented 98% of the population but had little power
The Declaration of the Rights of Man reflected Enlightenment ideals
Women marched on Versailles demanding bread and action
The Reign of Terror (1793-1794) claimed around 40,000 lives
Marie Antoinette was executed by guillotine in 1793
The Revolutionary Calendar was created to break with tradition
Robespierre was executed, ending the most violent phase
The metric system was introduced during this period
Changed government structures across all of Europe eventually
Feudalism was abolished and land redistributed
Church property was confiscated and sold
Nationalism became a driving force in European politics
Multiple constitutions were created and abandoned
Radical changes aimed to completely restructure society
Women's rights movements gained momentum from revolutionary ideals
Military campaigns spread revolutionary ideals beyond France
The Revolution inspired subsequent Latin American independence movements
It fundamentally transformed the relationship between state and citizen

profiles.name: The Silk Road
clues: Not a single road but a network of trade routes spanning over 4,000 miles
Connected China with Central Asia, the Middle East, and Europe
Silk production was a closely guarded secret in China for centuries
Trade goods included spices, jade, glass, ceramics, and metals
Cultural exchange facilitated by traders was as important as goods
Buddhism spread along these routes from India to East Asia
The Venetian merchant family Polo traveled these routes in the 13th century
Nomadic tribes like the Mongols controlled portions and extracted taxes
Cities like Samarkand became prosperous trade hubs
Arab merchants often served as middlemen between Asia and Europe
Peak activity occurred during the Tang Dynasty (618-907 AD)
Mongol unification under Kublai Khan created unprecedented safety for traders
Maritime routes eventually competed with and partially replaced overland paths
Disease transmission was a downside of increased contact
Printing technology, gunpowder, and mathematics traveled westward
Caravanserais (roadside inns) provided shelter for traveling merchants
Political instability and wars eventually disrupted major trade flows
Portuguese seeking sea routes to Asia hoped to bypass middlemen
Archaeological evidence comes from trade cities and caravanserai remains
Economic impact on European markets was profound and transformative

profiles.name: The Russian Revolution
clues: Occurred in two major phases: February and October revolutions of 1917
World War I losses and food shortages triggered initial unrest
The February Revolution forced Tsar Nicholas II to abdicate
Bolsheviks, led by Lenin, seized power in the October Revolution
The Russian Civil War lasted from 1918-1922 with approximately 8 million deaths
The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics was established in 1922
War Communism policies included grain requisitions that caused starvation
The New Economic Policy temporarily allowed limited capitalism
Trotsky and Stalin competed for power after Lenin's death
Stalin emerged victorious and implemented rapid industrialization
Collectivization of agriculture caused the Holodomor famine in Ukraine
Millions of 'kulaks' (wealthy farmers) were executed or deported
Inspired communist movements worldwide throughout the 20th century
The Trans-Siberian Railway became a crucial logistical tool
Women gained voting rights earlier than in many Western nations
Early educational reforms attempted to reshape Soviet society
The revolution represented a complete overhaul of the social order
Created ideological conflict that defined the 20th century
Marxist ideology was implemented for the first time at national scale
The Soviet model influenced decolonization movements in Asia and Africa
